title: Opposition to Schedule F
comment: I strongly oppose the proposed Schedule F rule. This would undermine the civil service system that has served our country well for generations.
original_comment: I strongly oppose the proposed Schedule F rule. This would undermine the civil service system that has served our country well for generations.
key_quote: I strongly oppose the proposed Schedule F rule.
rationale: The comment clearly expresses opposition to the proposed rule, indicating that it would undermine the civil service system, which aligns with concerns about maintaining a merit-based system.

title: Support for Schedule F
comment: I support the Schedule F proposal as it will allow agencies to better address performance issues and increase accountability.
original_comment: I support the Schedule F proposal as it will allow agencies to better address performance issues and increase accountability.
key_quote: I support the Schedule F proposal as it will allow agencies to better address performance issues and increase accountability.
rationale: The comment explicitly states support for the Schedule F proposal, indicating a positive stance towards the rule.

title: Concerns about Due Process
comment: The proposed rule raises significant concerns about due process rights for federal employees and could lead to politicization of the civil service.
original_comment: The proposed rule raises significant concerns about due process rights for federal employees and could lead to politicization of the civil service.
key_quote: The proposed rule raises significant concerns about due process rights for federal employees and could lead to politicization of the civil service.
rationale: The comment explicitly states concerns about due process rights and the potential for politicization, indicating opposition to the proposed rule.
